message.content:
cs.CV, cs.CL, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM. 

The paper deals with the problem of video question answering, which involves visual information retrieval and modeling the temporal dynamics of video contents. This suggests that the paper is likely to belong to the Computer Vision (cs.CV) and Natural Language Processing (cs.CL) sub-categories. Additionally, the proposed attribute-augmented attention network learning framework and multi-step reasoning process involve machine learning techniques, which could place the paper in the Artificial Intelligence (cs.AI) and Machine Learning (cs.LG) sub-categories. Finally, the paper also mentions constructing a large-scale video question answering dataset, which could suggest that it belongs to the Multimedia (cs.MM) sub-category.
